name: China
funFact: China’s Great Wall stretches over 13,000 miles.

name: India
funFact: India is the world’s largest democracy.

name: United States
funFact: The US has no official language at the federal level.

name: Indonesia
funFact: Indonesia is the world’s largest archipelago with over 17,000 islands.

name: Pakistan
funFact: Pakistan is home to the world’s second highest mountain, K2.

name: Nigeria
funFact: Nigeria is Africa’s largest economy by GDP.

name: Brazil
funFact: Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the world’s largest tropical rainforest.

name: Bangladesh
funFact: Bangladesh has one of the world’s highest population densities.

name: Russia
funFact: Russia spans 11 time zones.

name: Mexico
funFact: Mexico City sinks about 10 inches per year due to groundwater extraction.

name: Japan
funFact: Tokyo is the world’s most populous metropolitan area.

name: Ethiopia
funFact: Ethiopia follows its own calendar, which is about 7 years behind the Gregorian calendar.

name: Philippines
funFact: The Philippines is the world’s second-largest archipelago.

name: Egypt
funFact: Egypt’s Giza pyramids are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

name: Vietnam
funFact: Vietnam is the world’s largest cashew nut producer.

name: DR Congo
funFact: The Congo River is the world’s deepest river.

name: Turkey
funFact: Istanbul is the only city in the world that spans two continents.

name: Iran
funFact: Persian carpets from Iran can take years to hand-weave.

name: Germany
funFact: Germany has over 1,500 types of beer.

name: Thailand
funFact: Thailand was formerly known as Siam until 1939.

name: United Kingdom
funFact: The UK consists of England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.

name: France
funFact: France is the most visited country in the world.

name: Italy
funFact: Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

name: Tanzania
funFact: Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa’s highest peak, is in Tanzania.

name: South Africa
funFact: South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.

name: Myanmar
funFact: Myanmar’s Bagan plain has over 2,000 ancient temples.

name: Kenya
funFact: The Great Rift Valley runs through Kenya.

name: South Korea
funFact: South Korea has the world’s fastest average internet speed.

name: Colombia
funFact: Colombia produces over 80% of the world’s emeralds.

name: Spain
funFact: Spain has the world’s oldest restaurant, Botín, founded in 1725.

name: Uganda
funFact: Uganda is known as the “Pearl of Africa.”

name: Argentina
funFact: Argentina was the first country in Latin America to legalize same-sex marriage.

name: Algeria
funFact: Algeria is the largest country in Africa by land area.

name: Sudan
funFact: Sudan has more pyramids than any other country.

name: Ukraine
funFact: Ukraine is the largest country entirely within Europe.

name: Iraq
funFact: Iraq is home to the ancient Mesopotamian civilization, the “Cradle of Civilization.”

name: Afghanistan
funFact: Afghanistan is known as the “Roof of the World” due to the Hindu Kush range.

name: Poland
funFact: Poland has the world’s largest castle by land area, Malbork Castle.

name: Canada
funFact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country.

name: Morocco
funFact: Morocco’s city of Fès is home to the world’s oldest continuously operating university.

name: Saudi Arabia
funFact: Saudi Arabia is the world’s largest oil exporter.

name: Uzbekistan
funFact: Uzbekistan is home to the historic Silk Road city of Samarkand.

name: Peru
funFact: Machu Picchu in Peru is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

name: Angola
funFact: Angola’s Kissama National Park is famous for its elephant migrations.

name: Malaysia
funFact: Malaysia’s Petronas Towers were the tallest buildings in the world from 1998–2004.

name: Mozambique
funFact: Mozambique has one of the world’s longest coastlines on the Indian Ocean.

name: Ghana
funFact: Ghana was the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from colonial rule.

name: Yemen
funFact: Yemen’s Socotra Island has the dragon’s blood tree, found nowhere else.

name: Nepal
funFact: Nepal is home to eight of the world’s ten highest peaks, including Everest.

name: Venezuela
funFact: Venezuela has the world’s highest waterfall, Angel Falls.
